env_feature.description: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Compared to biome, feature is a descriptor of the more local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
env_feature.title: environment (feature)

project_name.description: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized
project_name.title: project name

assembly.title: assembly
assembly.description: How was the assembly done (e.g. with a text based assembler like phrap or a flowgram assembler); estimated error rate associated with the finished sequences (e.g. error rate of 1 in 1000 bp); and the method of calculation

submitted_to_insdc.description: Depending on the study (large-scale e.g. done with next generation sequencing technology, or small-scale) sequences have to be submitted to SRA (Sequence Read Archive), DRA (DDBJ Read Archive) or via the classical Webin/Sequin systems to Genbank, ENA and DDBJ. Although this field is mandatory, it is meant as a self-test field, therefore it is not necessary to include this field in contextual data submitted to databases
submitted_to_insdc.title: submitted to insdc

seq_meth.description: Sequencing method used; e.g. Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid
seq_meth.title: sequencing method

propagation.description: This field is specific to different taxa. For phages: lytic/lysogenic, for plasmids: incompatibility group (Note: there is the strong opinion to name phage propagation obligately lytic or temperate, therefore we also give this choice
propagation.title: propagation

collection_date.description: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO8601 compliant
collection_date.title: collection date

env_package.title: environmental package
env_package.description: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported

env_biome.description: Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Biome should be treated as the descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
env_biome.title: environment (biome)

investigation_type.title: investigation type
investigation_type.description: Nucleic Acid Sequence Report is the root element of all MIGS/MIMS compliant reports as standardized by Genomic Standards Consortium. This field is either eukaryote,bacteria,virus,plasmid,organelle, metagenome,mimarks-survey, or mimarks-specimen

isol_growth_condt.description: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material
isol_growth_condt.title: isolation and growth condition

geo_loc_name.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (v 1.512) (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)
geo_loc_name.title: geographic location (country and/or sea,region)

env_material.description: The environmental material level refers to the material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Environmental material terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
env_material.title: environment (material)

lat_lon.title: geographic location (latitude and longitude)
lat_lon.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

env_feature.description: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Compared to biome, feature is a descriptor of the more local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
env_feature.title: environment (feature)

finishing_strategy.description: Was the genome project intended to produce a complete or draft genome, Coverage, the fold coverage of the sequencing expressed as 2x, 3x, 18x  etc, and how many contigs were produced for the genome
finishing_strategy.title: finishing strategy

assembly.title: assembly
assembly.description: How was the assembly done (e.g. with a text based assembler like phrap or a flowgram assembler); estimated error rate associated with the finished sequences (e.g. error rate of 1 in 1000 bp); and the method of calculation

submitted_to_insdc.description: Depending on the study (large-scale e.g. done with next generation sequencing technology, or small-scale) sequences have to be submitted to SRA (Sequence Read Archive), DRA (DDBJ Read Archive) or via the classical Webin/Sequin systems to Genbank, ENA and DDBJ. Although this field is mandatory, it is meant as a self-test field, therefore it is not necessary to include this field in contextual data submitted to databases

seq_meth.title: sequencing method

propagation.title: propagation

collection_date.description: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO8601 compliant
collection_date.title: collection date

project_name.description: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized
project_name.title: project name

env_package.title: environmental package

All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported

env_biome.description: Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Biome should be treated as the descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
env_biome.title: environment (biome)

investigation_type.title: investigation type
investigation_type.description: Nucleic Acid Sequence Report is the root element of all MIGS/MIMS compliant reports as standardized by Genomic Standards Consortium. This field is either eukaryote,bacteria,virus,plasmid,organelle, metagenome,mimarks-survey, or mimarks-specimen

estimated_size.description: The estimated size of the genome prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period.
estimated_size.title: estimated size

isol_growth_condt.description: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material
isol_growth_condt.title: isolation and growth condition

num_replicons.description: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote
num_replicons.title: number of replicons

geo_loc_name.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (v 1.512) (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)
geo_loc_name.title: geographic location (country and/or sea,region)

env_material.description: The environmental material level refers to the material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Environmental material terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
env_material.title: environment (material)

ploidy.description: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2013-10-28) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO
ploidy.title: ploidy

lat_lon.title: geographic location (latitude and longitude)
lat_lon.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

depth.description: Please refer to the definitions of depth in the environmental packages
depth.title: geographic location (depth)

elev.description: the elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level
elev.title: elevation

env_feature.description: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Compared to biome, feature is a descriptor of the more local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

env_material.title: environment (material)

lat_lon.title: geographic location (latitude and longitude)
lat_lon.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

env_feature.description: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Compared to biome, feature is a descriptor of the more local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
env_feature.title: environment (feature)

project_name.description: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized
project_name.title: project name

assembly.title: assembly
assembly.description: How was the assembly done (e.g. with a text based assembler like phrap or a flowgram assembler); estimated error rate associated with the finished sequences (e.g. error rate of 1 in 1000 bp); and the method of calculation

submitted_to_insdc.description: Depending on the study (large-scale e.g. done with next generation sequencing technology, or small-scale) sequences have to be submitted to SRA (Sequence Read Archive), DRA (DDBJ Read Archive) or via the classical Webin/Sequin systems to Genbank, ENA and DDBJ. Although this field is mandatory, it is meant as a self-test field, therefore it is not necessary to include this field in contextual data submitted to databases
submitted_to_insdc.title: submitted to insdc

seq_meth.description: Sequencing method used; e.g. Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid
seq_meth.title: sequencing method

collection_date.description: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO8601 compliant
collection_date.title: collection date

env_package.title: environmental package
env_package.description: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported

env_biome.description: Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Biome should be treated as the descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
env_biome.title: environment (biome)

investigation_type.title: investigation type
investigation_type.description: Nucleic Acid Sequence Report is the root element of all MIGS/MIMS compliant reports as standardized by Genomic Standards Consortium. This field is either eukaryote,bacteria,virus,plasmid,organelle, metagenome,mimarks-survey, or mimarks-specimen

geo_loc_name.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (v 1.512) (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)
geo_loc_name.title: geographic location (country and/or sea,region)

env_material.description: The environmental material level refers to the material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Environmental material terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
env_material.title: environment (material)

lat_lon.title: geographic location (latitude and longitude)
lat_lon.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

air_temp.description: temperature of the air at the time of sampling
air_temp.title: air temperature

heat_cool_type.title: heating and cooling system type
heat_cool_type.description: methods of conditioning or heating a room or building

rel_air_humidity.description: partial vapor and air pressure, density of the vapor and air, or by the actual mass of the vapor and air
rel_air_humidity.title: relative air humidity

indoor_space.title: indoor space
indoor_space.description: a distinguishable space within a structure, the purpose for which discrete areas of a building is used

space_typ_state.title: space typical state
space_typ_state.description: customary or normal state of the space

ventilation_type.description: ventilation system used in the sampled premises
ventilation_type.title: ventilation type

filter_type.title: filter type
filter_type.description: a device which removes solid particulates or airborne molecular contaminants

occup_samp.description: number of occupants present at time of sample within the given space
occup_samp.title: occupancy at sampling

carb_dioxide.description: carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
carb_dioxide.title: carbon dioxide

occupant_dens_samp.description: average number of occupants at time of sampling per square footage
occupant_dens_samp.title: occupant density at sampling

organism_count.description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts
organism_count.title: organism count

build_occup_type.title: building occupancy type
build_occup_type.description: the primary function for which a building or discrete part of a building is intended to be used

abs_air_humidity.description: actual mass of water vapor - mh20 - present in the air water vapor mixture
abs_air_humidity.title: absolute air humidity

building_setting.title: building setting
building_setting.description: a location (geography) where a building is set

light_type.title: light type
light_type.description: application of light to achieve some practical or aesthetic effect. Lighting includes the use of both artificial light sources such as lamps and light fixtures, as well as natural illumination by capturing daylight. Can also include absence of light

typ_occupant_dens.description: customary or normal density of occupants
typ_occupant_dens.title: typical occupant density

alt.description: the altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air
alt.title: altitude

depth.description: Please refer to the definitions of depth in the environmental packages
depth.title: geographic location (depth)

elev.description: the elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level
elev.title: elevation

depth.description: Please refer to the definitions of depth in the environmental packages
depth.title: geographic location (depth)

elev.description: the elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level
elev.title: elevation
